I hesitate to make this comment. Dr. Robitaille from Ohio State University largely concluded that black hole images are basically a collection of artefacts summarized in a photo. He's not a nobody, and there are several other well known astronomers that have looked at the data and agree. This viewpoint completely deflates all of the hype (even mine) and makes one wonder how much money has been wasted if true. His explanation is given on his YouTube channel "Sky Scholar".

Using it to describe such complicate situation is dangerous

These are fake images. They only produced them because people wanted a black hole picture. They didn't actually image a black hole and the scientists responsible for the images have admitted it in their papers.

They took a library catalog of black hole pictures from simulations and artistic impressions.

The telescope then collected digital datasets. Pixel fluctuations, basically signal noise was measured. They then wrote an algorithm to rate the pixel data to find the ones that most conform to the pictures from the library. Those images were brought to the front in order to produce the "expected" Black Hole.

They gave the public a picture of the Black Hole because the public wanted a picture of a Black Hole. You've all been conned.

The real pictures are far more interesting and far more beneficial to scientific research. For every pixel that they farmed to create their black hole, a thousand pictures show no black hole at all.

So I have a question for you that no one until now was able to answer me. I also can‘t find the answer via google.

Q: How long can you hold your breath while under water?


I know this sounds trivial but the tricky part about this question is that I want to know how long you can hold your breath at a higher pressure, not during descending/ascending. So imagine you are scuba diving and staying at a depth of 20m. You don’t change your depth during this experiment. There are about 3bars of pressure down there so the air you breath has a density about 3 times as high as on sea level. The amount of air you breath in is thus about three times of that on the sea level. Volume stays the same but density is higher.

Why can‘t you hold your breath longer if there are 3 times as many molecules in your lung?

I have asked a couple of scuba dive instructors about this but no one could answer the question. My guess is that I just don‘t exactly understand the biomolecular side of the problem.

Very nicely explained. But he circumvented a little bit the actual problem, which is overinterpretation of data.
If we would also see the surroundings of this image, if it weren't conveniently cropped, we would see a lot of more bright structures. They just picked one area for convenience, because the data fitted the model.
If we look closer at the image, we see actually three bright spots that form the alleged halo of the Black Hole. This does not fit the description of a Black Hole. What we possibly see there are three hot areas that create the image of a ring because of the low resolution. But it seems to be an optical illusion rather than a ring.
They claim that the diameter of the ring fits the calculation of the shadow of the Black Hole. But fact is that they cannot measure the mass other than calculating it based on the diameter of this ring. Since it is calculated and not measured, they used circular logic, and the conclusion became the premise.

What we have here is sensationalism in order to justify further funding, it's not actual scientific observation. If there is a super-massive Black Hole in the center of the galaxy the surrounding conditions would not allow us to produce an image of it. Keep in mind that our solar system is exactly located on the plane of our galaxy and all its matter is between us and the alleged Black Hole. We are not looking from the top. The idea that any radiation would penetrate all the matter between the center of the galaxy and us is absurd. So whatever we see on that image is unclear. It could be anything. A connection with a Black Hole in the center of the galaxy is speculative and highly unlikely. But their PR department did a good job in selling this image to the public along with some doubtful explanations and claims.

To be clear, what we are seeing here is a photograph of these two black holes. Think of an x-ray of a broken bone. Think of an MRI scan, that shows the structure of the brain.   Does anyone doubt that the x-ray is a photo of the bone? Does anyone doubt that the MRI is a photo of the brain? No. But no human can see the light used to make these photos. These photos of black holes are no different. They gather image data using radio frequency light. Then just like x-ray, or MRI, a computer program processes the data into an image our eyes can see. And this image of a black hole is just as real as the image of a bone or brain. A photo of Pluto taken by the New Horizons space probe also depends utterly on computers. These four imaging systems use four wavelength bands of electromagnetic radiation: x-ray from 10 picometers to 10 nanometers, visible from 400 nanometers to 700 nanometers, the Event Horizon Telescope from 1.3 millimeters, and the MRI from 10 meters to 100 meters. (MRI does not actually produce electromagnetic radiation, nor broadcast it. The M in MRI stands for Magnetic, and the instrument produces almost only the magnetic part of the electromagnetic radiation. However the frequency it uses is as listed, and it does produce a tiny amount of true electromagnetic radiation in that frequency band.)

So how can we ever get an "image" of the black hole from the photons that were warped even 180 degrees, all we can ever see is the accretion disc.

The 6th and last webinar of the World Summit on Combating and Preventing Forced Organ Harvesting took place on September 26, with several guest speakers discussing policies and legislation needed to help end the forced organ harvesting crimes by the Chinese Communist Party (CCP). The speakers included a parliament member, a medical professor, a journalist, and human rights advocates.


Six online forums were held during the World Summit on Combating and Preventing Forced Organ Harvesting, an online event over two weekends from September 17 to 26. Thirty-eight speakers from 19 countries participated.

One of the speakers, Elisabetta Zamparutti, is a lawyer and member of the Committee for the Prevention of Torture, Council of Europe, Italy. As a former member of the Italian Parliament, Ms. Zamparutti is also a board member of “Prison Insider,” an NGO for worldwide information on prison conditions. She is considered an expert in monitoring prison conditions and treatment of detainees.

In her speech, Zamparutti called on international organizations such as the United Nations and the Council of the European Union, as well as the general public, to take action against the CCP’s crime of forced organ harvesting.

“Fundamental rights, inviolable principles such as the right to life, to physical integrity, to mental integrity, to freedom are systematically violated by this totalitarian regime,” she explained. As a result, people are wronged, government officials commit wrongdoings, and torture is prevalent across China, not to mention the unimaginable brutality of forced organ harvesting. While a government is supposed to protect its people, the CCP detains citizens based on their belief and kills them for their organs.

Zamparutti said she was shocked to learn that the main victims of the atrocity are practitioners of Falun Gong, a meditation system practiced by nearly 100 million people in China. In fact, the rate of organ harvesting in China has reached an industrial scale and is carried out for profit. Ironically, medical professionals, including doctors, surgeons, anesthetists, and nurses, who are supposed to save lives, have unfortunately become part of this killing machine. The very existence of such a machine is perplexing; meanwhile, Ms. Zamparutti noted that it begs a feeling of shame – we know that the crime is continuing, and yet many of us are maintaining a closer and closer relationship with the CCP.

That is why we need intervention from the international community, commented Zamparutti. She believes that “crimes against humanity” is the most accurate description of the forced organ harvesting, as defined by the China Tribunal established in London in 2018. The tribunal found that the CCP had conducted systematic physical examinations of Falun Gong practitioners in preparation for organ extraction. Evidence has also shown that Falun Gong practitioners had their organs harvested even before they were confirmed as brain dead.

“Now this is a truly hellish scenario that must lead us to mobilize as organizations committed to the protection of human rights, as individuals, and also as institutions. I think that there should be an appeal to everyone, to citizens but also to supranational bodies,” stated Zamparutti.

She added, “The UN has intervened, but we must also address the World Health Organization, the Council of Europe, the European Parliament, all those bodies that can intervene and that can especially give indications so that there is no cooperation [on this issue] with China.”

She suggested placing forced organ harvesting as a priority issue in any bilateral or multilateral discussion with the Chinese regime. “In the face of this shame of humanity, we must also ask ourselves what we can do to change the situation,” she said. At the very least, she believes that people can spread the information so that broad discussion can take place for the public to know what is going on.

“The brutality needs to be fully exposed in order to stop this crime committed by the CCP,” Zamparutti explained. She suggested that people practice “what the Chinese regime wants to erase” – Falun Gong’s principles of Truthfulness-Compassion-Forbearance. She said that the CCP intends to wipe out traditional values from people’s minds, and that is why it has detained Falun Gong practitioners and killed them ruthlessly for organ harvesting.

Ms. Zamparutti highlighted the importance of cherishing Truthfulness-Compassion-Forbearance, stating that during this battle between good and evil, we need these values and will gain strength from them.

Falun Gong Practitioners Are Main Victims of Organ Harvesting
The China Tribunal, an Independent tribunal investigating allegations of forced organ harvesting from prisoners of conscience in China, released a judgment on this issue in June 2019. “Forced organ harvesting has been committed for years throughout China on a significant scale and Falun Gong practitioners have been one – and probably the main – source of organ supply,” wrote the judgment.


Sir Geoffrey Nice QC spoke at the hearing.

Sir Geoffrey Nice QC, chair of the China Tribunal, spoke at the hearing. He said that the Tribunal examined the evidence in detail, and its members then reached a unanimous conclusion that forced organ harvesting from prisoners of conscience has been practiced in China for a long time.

The judgment was initially delivered orally, followed by a summary judgment in June 2019 and a full judgment in March 2020. The judgment shows that the CCP killed people and sold their organs for profit. Sir Geoffrey pointed out that the report has many pages of reference and that the conclusions have remained unchallenged.

The First Picture of the Black Hole at the Milky Way’s Heart Has Been Reveale
First image of Sagittarius A*, the supermassive black hole at the center of the Milky Way, as captured by the Event Horizon Telescope.

The mystery at the heart of the Milky Way has finally been solved. This morning, at simultaneous press conferences around the world, the astronomers of the Event Horizon Telescope (EHT) revealed the first image of Sagittarius A*, the supermassive black hole at the center of the Milky Way.

At the National Press Club in Washington, D.C., this morning, Feryal Özel, a professor of astronomy and physics at the University of Arizona and a member of the EHT Science Council, introduced the picture, a dark ring framed by three shining knots of trillion-degree gas. “I met [Sagittarius A*] 20 years ago and have loved it and tried to understand it since,” Özel said. “But until now, we didn’t have the direct picture.

Black holes trap everything that falls in, including light, so they are, in a very real sense, unseeable. But they warp spacetime around them so severely that, when they are illuminated by glowing streams of infalling matter shredded in their gravitational grip, they cast a “shadow.” The shadow is about two and a half times larger than a black hole’s event horizon: its boundary and its defining feature, the line in spacetime through which nothing that passes can ever return.

The image is from the international consortium behind the Event Horzon
Telescope, a collection of eight synchronised radio telescope around the world.

It is crazy to me that they can record the data with such precision. 1 femtosecond is one millionth of a nanosecond, which is approximately the time it takes your CPU to complete one cycle. In other words, the sensors are running 1 million times faster than a computer (of course, they have many computers to do the recording). Then, you have the problem of trying to line up the data from different sources. It's one thing to locally run your sensor at 1 million GHz. It's another to figure out how the data from your sensor lines up with data from somebody else's sensor, which is exactly the "secret sauce" that makes the Event Horizon Telescope possible.

Black hole nerd here! I'm actually glad this video is made since not many people like talking about them.

So so, black holes are easier to understand when compared to planets, even stars. Each object has their own gravity, it being either weak or strong. Black Holes are just super massive compact objects that their gravity even affects light.

Technically speaking, with our current technology we cannot "see black holes", but "observe" the effect these have what is nearby. It is explained pretty well!

Now, comparing Black Holes to planet Earth. The "event horizon" is thought to be the "black curtain" that could be compare to an "atmosphere". At some point, when you get too close to Earth you would start falling into it. Same thing with Black Holes. Now say you are orbiting around it at the right angle/velocity, you would just be going around like a moon, satellite.

The "singularity" is not the event horizon. It is theory that can exist logically by Einstein's Theory of relativity. With enough force you can breakdown space and time.

Black holes spin, this can be proven by how they affect nearby objects and "jets" that actually escape the event horizon. We don't know if these were ever inside, but it's very unlikely.

As of today, it is impossible to know what happens inside a black hole, since information is lost due to the event horizon. Maybe in the future we can or in a way using quantum physics' string theory.

Also also also!!! These "images" we see anything that's super far away, it's what they looked like many years ago. It is thought that Sagittarius A* is 26,000 light-years away, so we see it how it was 26k ago, and we will never know how it looks now...until 26k more years pass by. I believe this doesn't include any variables that can alter it's space-visibility.

The blurriness in the signal from the radio telescopes looks very much like a simple convolution applied to the original signal. The angular resolution basically determines the scale of the kernel function for the convolution. If we can capture enough samples with a single telescope, even though they are blurry, it should be possible to undo the convolution using Fourier transform. I'm pretty sure this doesn't work, because otherwise this technique would be used. So why not?

15:00: "It is 2.6 times bigger than the event horizon." Actually, it is either "2.6 times the size of the event horizon," or "1.6 times bigger than the event horizon." A lot of people make the mistake of saying something is x times bigger than, when they mean to say that it is x times the size of. The difference is that additional x being added or not.

It's the crossover between math and language that gets people hung up sometimes. )-:

Just a small add on, when you talk about the shadow of the black hole at the end of the video, you are assuming there is some big light source behind it / around it, making all possible light directions possible. The reality is not as simple as that. In fact, most of the light we observe will come from the accretion disk itself, and the way it is sourced, heavily dependends on the unknown plasma physics of the disk. So in fact, black hole shadows are very intricate objects, and we can't still  use the shape of the shadow to precisely infer parameters like the black hole mass, or the rotation speed, or even small possible modifications to general relativity

Wave particle duality is clearly a feature of "light" one that was incorrectly dismissed by the Michelson/Morley experiment based on the subsequent knowledge of quantum behaviour, and one which is in fact proven incorrect if a Black Hole is what we think it is! There is no question in my mind that whatever a Black Hole is, it is in fact what it is not! Therefore it can reasonably be assumed that a Black Hole is Quantum in nature and likely the idea that we explain the Physics of a Black Hole as a function of gravity and the so called event horizon is fundamentally incorrect. Gravity as a force is a curious expression best defined by relativity, yet we do not know, how the nature of gravity properly expresses itself at a local level, rather that we observe and measure it's effects according to nothing more than an inverse square law principal observed and validated largely through Newtonian physics.. Now this is a principle at work in electro/magnetic theory and is well understood, but currently the observable reality of a black hole being an object about which entire galaxies rotate is not consistent with an inverse square law argument. In fact the escape velocity of most objects in the milky way could not be sustained by even an object of infinite mass if such an object were subject to the inverse square law nature of gravity.

Our atmosphere does absorb some light. that's not really the main concern here. the main reason we need an earth sized telescope is because we don't have the technology to do digital interferometry with short wavelengths. Since the EHT uses much longer wavelengths than visible light, this means the telescope has to be thousands of kilometers wide. an optical telescope would need to be 116 kilometers wide. optical interferometers require tunnels and high precision mirrors which loose a lot of the light that came in. building 100 kilometers long tunnels with several hundred meter wide telescopes on each end is currently not considered worthwhile. If computers were more powerful we would use shorter wavelengths and digital interferometry.

For some reason people dont know that Einstein repeatedly said that singularities are not possible. Wherever you have an astronomical quantity of mass "dilation" (sometimes called gamma or y) will occur. Mass that is dilated is smeared through spacetime relative to an outside observer. General relativity does not predict singularities when you factor in dilation, Einstein wrote about this in the 1939 journal "Annals of Mathematics". Nobody believed in black holes when he was alive for this reason. There is no place in the universe where mass is more concentrated than at the center of a galaxy. 99.8% of the mass in our solar system is in the sun. 99.9% of the mass of an atom is in the nucleus. If these norms are true for galaxies than we can infer that there is 100's of trillions of solar masses at the center of high mass galaxies. There is no way to know through observation, there is far too much interference, dilation and gravitational lensing. High mass means high momentum. If we attribute a radius to these numbers than we can calculate that relativistic velocities exist in these regions.
The mass at the center of our own galaxy is dilated, in some sublime way that mass is all around us, there is no direction you can point your finger that you are not pointing to it. This is the explanation for the abnormally high rotation rates of stars in high mass galaxies (the reason for the theory of dark matter). Low mass galaxies have normal star rotation rates, this is what relativity would predict because there is an insufficient quantity of mass to achieve relativistic velocities. This to me is clear proof that Einstein was correct, there can be no other realistic explanation for this fact.
If you pose the question "why cant we see light from the galactic center" the modern answer would be because gravitational forces there are so strong that not even light can escape (even though the mass of the photon is zero). Einstein's answer would be because the mass there is dilated relative to an Earth bound observer. Einstein's answer perfectly explains the greatest mystery in science (the rotation rates of stars in spiral galaxies).
The belief in black holes gradually came about after television and magazines put that counterintuitive image in peoples minds. All images and data from galactic centers is in line with relativity.

Something I wrote for an old class. Not perfect looking at it now, but there are some crazy ideas that are thought invoking.

It is believed, that black holes are formed in the aftermath of a supernova with the collapse of a star’s core, when, in actuality, the answer could be much more simple and less general. Particularly, it is believed that when a very massive star ends its life in a supernova, the remaining matter collapses in upon itself. Then, if there is enough mass in this collapsed star, a black hole is formed. Although this seems to answer the question, we have to put faith in the idea that a black hole is, in fact, formed this way because we have no means of proving this. Conversely, if we take what we know about physics and reality by observing what is apparent, we can potentially arrive at more sensible conclusions. First, we must establish that when we use the speed of light (c) as the ultimate means of measurement and observation of the universe at vast distances, we lose the ability to accurately observe phenomenon that could exist beyond that threshold. Considering this, we can describe black hole formation by atoms that exceed c and, in turn, propagate at that inherent velocity. Notably, when an atom exceeds c, its comprising subatomic particles achieve the same potential. For example, imagine a bug net and two insects that fly at separate speeds. When both bugs are trapped in a bug net, they both equal its speed and each others as well. As a result they are no longer able to separate themselves. Comparatively, when an atom loses its structure and its apparent field, it results in a total collapse. Specifically, the effect of an atom which contains roughly 99% empty space collapsing is such that its subatomic particles will group tightly together and the resulting formation will reach a 99% greater density. Furthermore, when the new formation of subatomic particles collides with atoms of lesser potential, those atoms will reach the faster potential of the formation, collapse and add to the concentrated and growing mass of subatomic particles. Ultimately, the compounding effect of the growing collection of tightly packed subatomic particles traveling beyond c will result in the formation of a black hole.

It’s a popular scientific belief that light appears warped near a black hole due to its immense gravity bending it, but that could be a limit of our perception. For example, when we use a camera to take a picture of a fast moving object and use a slower shutter speed, the object appears to be blurred. With the same logic, when you envision c as the shutter speed of the camera, everything slower than it will appear clearly and everything faster will seem blurred. Therefore, if we can accept that a black hole actually travels faster than c, then we can argue that it only appears to bend light as a result of the contrast of speed.

Constantly unexplained fluctuating energy levels in the universe are explained by modern science, (and science fiction,) to be a result of energy transfer between parallel dimensions however, a more realistic explanation exists. This anomaly could actually be explained by the formation of black holes and their ultimate disjointing. First, when an atom is broken down into its basic components and those components are tightly compressed, they cease to emit measurable energy. Eventually, a black hole slows to a point below that of c by colliding with enough atoms to equal the potential that caused its initial particles to exceed c. Subsequently, the subatomic particles will no longer be at equivalent potentials and the result will be the instantaneous formation of new atoms and their associated fields. As a result a rapid simultaneous expansion of atoms in all directions will occur, which will introduce a considerable amount of measurable energy into the universe.

According to the Big Bang theory, the universe was once in an extremely hot and dense state which expanded rapidly, but how could scientists have ever come to this conclusion without explaining why and how it arrived at that state in the first place? By applying the previously mentioned concepts, we can rationalize that the Big Bang was actually created by the disjointing of a black hole that had consumed the entire universe. To illustrate, a black hole moving at a velocity faster than c grew fast and to a point far beyond super massive. Furthermore, the superior speed accomplished by the black hole allowed it to reach the end of space expansion in all directions, enabling it to consume the universe in its entirety. When this occurred, the entire universe equaled the potential of the beyond super massive black hole and brought it to a point immediately below c. Consequently, the instantaneous formation of all atoms in the universe and their associated fields, as a result of every subatomic particle ceasing to exist at an equivalent potential, resulted in the massive, simultaneous expansion that we call the Big Bang. This resulted in the outermost particles having the pressure of all inner particles exerted upon them. The subsequent outermost particles had the same minus one inner particles exerted upon them. This is why the expansion of the universe is not constant, but rather that resembling the fibonacci sequence.

Black holes are just one example of a way the science community could be answering questions by using means that can’t be realistically comprehended. We live in a universe perceived by our senses and when we try to describe it by using inexplicable subject matter not observed this way, we arrive at unfulfilling answers. By utilizing a simplified rational approach to explain the universe’s most perplexing anomalies, we could arrive at revolutionary answers that may perhaps change the way we view the world.
Carl Sagan of our generation

I remember staring at that updated, swirling "Polarized" black hole image that was released a few months after the famous, blurry one, and trying to wrap my mind around how polarized lenses only take in focused light beams which pointed directly at you, which means the angle information from the image was, by definition, perfectly straight, perfectly direct, and perfectly focused. And yet, that polarized image of a black hole shows deep, beautiful, pronounced swirls of light spiraling a void.
With little knowledge of physics, I just kept staring at it until it finally clicked that the light wasn't from the black hole, it was from the stars behind or around the black hole, and that their light WAS moving in a singular, focused direction - I WAS looking at a perfectly straight line - that's just how severely time and space were bending along that "Straight" path. That was one of the first times I felt like I could finally see and visualize relativity and that fabric of Spacetime I've heard so much about.

Really cool video and explanations. There is one thing I would like to add to the explanation of the combination of the radio telescopes. The picture you showed is perfectly correct and may be viewed as resolving the ambiguity of the different antenna pairs. But if you were to zoom out to obtain a picture of a wider portion of the sky, you would see periodic repetitions of the picture (or rather the maximum of the field of the array formed by the antennas). Therefore, the procedure can only work since objects in the sky are sparesly distributed, since any light coming from a direction of one of these secondary beams would also be mapped onton the resulting picture.
This phenonemon is called Grating Lobes and it will always appear if the distance between the antennas in a multi-antenna array are further apart than half a wavelength. By the way there is a really cool link of this to a discrete fourier transform with undersampling.

Just wanted to nitpick on why the black hole is black: The common answer given, "because light that falls in can't escape to us" isn't really correct, at least not from our perspective.


For outside observers, nothing did or can ever cross the event horizon. It's not just a barrier in space, but in spacetime. Events that happen for objects falling into the black hole are completely cut off from the collective observations of outside observers. That's why it's called an "event horizon".

Everytime I see or read something about the shape of a black hole, I feel compelled to credit the original author of this design, just because he is almost never credited: it is French astrophysicist Jean-Pierre Luminet in his seminal book "Les Trous Noirs" (Black Holes) describing their physics and dynamic behaviour, and published in... 1987 (I still own an original copy of it, kindly signed by the author that I had met just a few years later while writing about the topic as a science journalist ans sci-fi writer). There's inside an illustration by his hand (JPL is also an artist - musician, painter and sculptor) depicting exactly this curved donut shape.

Calling this a "picture" misinforms the public into thinking this is a photograph. It is not a photograph by any stretch of the imagination. It is a computer generated image extrapolated from radio emissions collected from all over the world.
The colors, for example, are pure invention on the part of the computer programmer's as radio waves have no color or light.
The illustrators demonstration implies that this is all a two dimensional disc we are lucky enough to be viewing from the flat side. Nothing could be further from the truth. The phenomena has to be three dimensional by definition which would make a single point of view image virtually impossible, let alone a cross section.
This further demonstrates that this computer generated image is every bit as much of an invention as the model of the rings and the black plastic ball he is holding...

Thank you for the explanation. A black hole is a simple object, described by its mass, angular momentum, and electrical charge. Supermassive black holes are typically electrically neutral, so their mass and angular momentum parameters determine their gravitational fields. The gravitational field of a black hole determines how the black hole bend light rays inwards and thus how they appear to an observer on Earth. Light passing near the black hole is deflected by the strong gravitational field, producing a black hole shadow, a dark region that is often encircled by a bright light ring—whose size and shape correlate directly from the black hole’s mass and angular momentum.

The 3 orange regions in the accretion disk around the black hole is light from hot glowing gas. The reason why these regions are glowing more bright, is because you are looking at the side where material is moving towards us. It appears fainter on the side where it is moving away from us. It is called Doppler beaming.

Derek: "B-holes????"

Hi Derek, Thank you for the great videos! How about this idea: we have 1-car train, 2 observers (1 on station - Stef, 1 on train - Tracy), and a small light bulb in the centre of the 1-car train that will produce for simplicity 1 short flash of light with the brightness of a candle at the exact moment when one observer passes another.

On the ends of the moving 1-car train we'll have regular photo cameras so it captures the flash and by captured image (angular size and brightness) Tracy can eventually roughly estimate the distance from the camera to the lamp, which would be close to 1/2 of the car length.

Now let's run the train a few times with a constant speed each time closer and closer to the speed of light. Obviously with no acceleration between the flash and light reaching both cameras - no matter how fast the train goes the result images captured by 2 cameras will be pretty much the same across all experiments (camera on the front will give almost exact same images whether train goes at different speeds or simply stays in one place. The rear camera would produce a very similar set of almost identical images throughout different experiments since distance to the light source is the same and "The laws of physics are the same in all inertial frames of reference"). And yes - as we know: the simultaneous events in one frame of reference would not be simultaneous in another and vice versa, also the train will shrink more and more the faster it goes from Stef point of view and similarly the flying-by station will shrink for Tracy, but it is not the point here.

Let's concentrate on the front camera (facing backwards), which flash of light has to catch up (from stationary Stef point of view).

We will take Stef's perspective on it now.Stef can see the exact place where the light finally catches the front camera, which can be far from the station. The faster the train goes the further away from the station this point will be! We can choose the train speed so that the light reaches the front camera 98K light years away (near Ursa Major II Dwarf) from the station!
Now if we imagine Stef travel 98K light years away to assume another stationary position (not moving relatively to the original train station on Earth) and hangs in his fancy rocket ship with exact same regular camera in hands and waits for another flash of light coming from our ongoing periodic experiments, if he manages to speed-up his camera inside his stationary ship-lab so that camera sensor is flying away from the original light source at the exact same speed as the camera on the train, then his camera would produce exact same result as the camera on the train, which is regular image of small lamp only few meters away from the lense(!), bright enough to see all it's details!!! Basically you need to move the camera fast enough from the observed object to squeeze the space (up to the whole universe going almost as flat as a sheet of paper!)

And this is mind blowing! If Stef sitting far-far away and trying to take a picture with his camera without moving it (regular way), then only 1 or 2 photons per years will hit is lense, while if he moves camera fast enough away from the observed light source then suddenly billions of photons end up inside his lense (as if he's standing 1/2 train car length away from the source).

What if he now turns this upgraded "fast-moving-sensor-camera" FMSC towards the Sun while standing on Earth and calculates sensor move speed so that it takes a picture as if 1 mile away from the Sun surface? Will it suddenly completely burn the camera (one can think of fancy lighter which allows you to smoke from the Sun no matter how far)?

Also we don't have to actually move real camera inside our "stationary" lab, instead our "fancy sensor" can be implemented as a simple stream of ionized particles accelerated to the desired constant speed traveling away from the observed object at any desired speed, we only need to make them excited (or to loose pre-excited state) if photons from the observed object hit our stream of particles and then detect it somehow in the stationary lab.

Also for the stationary remote observed objects we don't have to try to invent the whole "moving away sensor". We have constant stream of photons from the remote object (not just 1 flash), for example some star or some galaxy. Thus we can "scan" our view field pixel by pixel slowly using one fast particle moving in a loop with controlled speed and somewhat controlled position. Btw, due to uncertainty principle (which says: we cannot know both the position and speed of a particle) we can use lenses in our "camera" and we can make our "sensor area" as large as we want (for example instead of trying to make a sensor area around 1 square centimeter as inside our eye, we can blow up the sensor screen area to few meters by meters) , so we can get any desired "resolution", thus the uncertainty principle is not a problem.

Cheers,
Dmitry Shevkoplyas

Here's a question about Hawking radiation:  I call this Hawking radiation paradox: If time runs faster outside the event horizon of a black hole than it does inside the black hole, Hawking radiation would evaporate the black hole before enough time has passed inside the black hole for such an event to have occurred. So how is it that a black hole could experience two frames of reference at the same time? There seems to be a real paradox here. If an observer inside a black hole looking out could survive long enough, could she witness hawking radiation evaporate the black hole before enough time in her frame of reference passed for the evaporation to occur?
